info.title: Audience API
info.description: The Audience API enables publishers and buyers to integrate data providers with PubMatic Audiences.

get.summary: Retrieve data usage by deal and audience
get.description: Use this method to retreive an aggregated data breakdown by deal and segment.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Buyer's numeric account unique identifier

parameters.name: accountType
parameters.description: Value is always: **BUYER**.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Select a category for the audience

parameters.name: dataUsageReportType
parameters.description: Pass the following values to request various date ranges

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Use with CUSTOM_RANGE report type to return a single date (in YYYY-MM-DD format).

parameters.name: dayLevel
parameters.description: TRUE - returns daily numbers FALSE - returns aggregated numbers

parameters.name: fromReportDate
parameters.description: Start date (PST). Use with CUSTOM_RANGE report type to set the query start date (in YYYY-MM-DD format).

parameters.name: liveDeals
parameters.description: TRUE - returns only revenue from deals that are currently active. FALSE - returns revenue for all deals, including those that are completed or paused.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specifies whether the data is sorted ascending (**ASC**, default) or descending (**DESC**)

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Specifies the response sort order. Pass in the name of the column by which you want to sort.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of rows to be included in the response.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Page number to fetch multiple-page results.

parameters.name: toReportDate
parameters.description: End date (PST). Use with CUSTOM_RANGE report type to set the query end date (in YYYY-MM-DD format).

get.summary: Retrieve summary of audience data usage
get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve aggregated data breakdown by deal and segment.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Buyer's numeric account unique identifier

parameters.name: accountType
parameters.description: Value is always **BUYER**.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Specifies the category of the audience

parameters.name: dataUsageReportType
parameters.description: Pass these values to request various date ranges.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Use with the **CUSTOM_RANGE** report type to return a single date (in **YYYY-MM-DD** format).

parameters.name: dayLevel
parameters.description: TRUE returns daily numbers. FALSE returns aggregated numbers.

parameters.name: fromReportDate
parameters.description: Start date (PST). Use with the **CUSTOM_RANGE** report type to set the query start date (in **YYYY-MM-DD** format).

parameters.name: liveDeals
parameters.description: TRUE returns revenue only from currently active deals. FALSE returns revenue for all deals, including those that are completed or paused.

parameters.name: toReportDate
parameters.description: End date (PST). Use with the **CUSTOM_RANGE** report type to set the query end date (in **YYYY-MM-DD** format).

get.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve daily or aggregated data containing all details:
* **Dimensions:** 
  - deal
  - audience name 
  - publisher 
  - buyer 
  - DSP
  - ad format 
  - deal type 
  - platform
 * **Metrics:**
   - paid impressions
   - spend
   - data spend

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Buyer's numeric account unique identifier

parameters.name: accountType
parameters.description: Value is always **BUYER**.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Specifies the category of the audience

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: Add this header if you want to get the response in comma-separated values format. Omitting this header returns a JSON response.

parameters.name: dataUsageReportType
parameters.description: Pass these values to request various date ranges.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Use with the **CUSTOM_RANGE** report type to return a single date (in **YYYY-MM-DD** format).

parameters.name: dayLevel
parameters.description: TRUE returns daily numbers. FALSE returns aggregated numbers.

parameters.name: fromReportDate
parameters.description: Start date (PST). Use with the **CUSTOM_RANGE** report type to set the query start date (in **YYYY-MM-DD** format).

parameters.name: liveDeals
parameters.description: TRUE returns revenue only from currently active deals. FALSE returns revenue for all deals, including those that are completed or paused.

parameters.name: toReportDate
parameters.description: End date (PST). Use with the **CUSTOM_RANGE** report type to set the query end date (in **YYYY-MM-DD** format).

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve a list of audiences registered under the same account on the PubMatic platform.

parameters.name: audienceCriteria
parameters.description: Attributes defining the audiences you want enumerated

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specification of whether to list audiences in ascending or descending order

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The criteria by which you want the audiences listed

post.description: First-party data providers (DMPs) who integrate directly with PubMatic can register audiences by providing the accountType parameter with the value of **PUBLISHER**, **BUYER**, or **DEMAND_PARTNER** along with the provider's PubMatic accountId. For data provider accounts, accountType should have the value of **BUYER**.

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve details for a specific audience on the PubMatic platform.

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the audience

parameters.name: audience
parameters.description: Query Parameter

patch.description: Use this endpoint to modify name, description, price, and enabled (active) flag. You can pass any of these four fields along with all required parameters. **Do not** use this method to modify custom boolean audiences created with audiences of more than one data provider. These audiences are immutable and can't be updated due to access control restrictions.

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: Unique identifying number of your audience

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a new combined audience. Combined audiences are composed of multiple audiences governed by **And**/**Or**/**Not** logic and allow for complex targeting rules. See also [**JSON expression rules and samples**](https://help.pubmatic.com/publisher/reference/json-expression-rules-and-samples).

patch.description: Use this endpoint to update an existing combined audience. You can modify any combination of fields including `name`, `description`, `price`, and `enabled` as well as the audience expression logic. See also [**Update rules and samples**](https://help.pubmatic.com/publisher/reference/update-rules-and-samples).

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the combined audience to update

parameters.name: isEventAction
parameters.description: Optional boolean flag to indicate if this is an event-driven action

400.description: Invalid PubToken or Invalid Audience ID

get.summary: Retrieve data for an account using a specified audience
get.description: Use this method to retreive ID-based, seller-defined-audience-based (SDA), or contextual data for an account by means of a specified audience.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The buyer's numeric account unique identifier

parameters.name: accountType
parameters.description: The type of account for which data is retrieved. Value is always: **BUYER**.

parameters.name: audienceType
parameters.description: The type of audience for which the data is retrieved. For example, **ALL_AUDIENCE**.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category for the audience

parameters.name: ownerAccountId
parameters.description: The owner's numeric account ID

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specifies whether the data is sorted ascending (**ASC** = default) or descending (**DESC**)

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Specifies the response sort order. Pass in the name of the column by which you want to sort.

parameters.name: ownerAccountType
parameters.description: The type of owner account for which data is retrieved. For example, **BUYER**.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Specifies the number of pages to return for multiple-page results

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specifies the number of rows the server returns

parameters.name: searchKey
parameters.description: A key word used for the audience search.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of export file. Supported values: **csv** and **xls**.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of publishers for a specified audience
get.description: Use this method to retreive a list of publishers for a specified audience.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The buyer's numeric account ID

parameters.name: accountType
parameters.description: The type of account for which data is retrieved. Value is always: **BUYER**.

parameters.name: audienceType
parameters.description: The type of audience for which the data is retrieved. For example, **ALL_AUDIENCE**.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category for the audience

parameters.name: geoId
parameters.description: The numeric ID for the audience's geographic region

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specifies whether the data is sorted ascending (**ASC** = default) or descending (**DESC**)

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Specifies the response sort order. Pass in the name of the column by which you want to sort.

parameters.name: ownerAccountId
parameters.description: The owner's numeric account ID

parameters.name: ownerAccountType
parameters.description: The type of owner account for which data is retrieved. For example, **BUYER**.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Specifies the number of pages to return for multiple-page results

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specifies the number of rows the server returns

parameters.name: publisherReach
parameters.description: The publishers for a specified audience

parameters.name: searchKey
parameters.description: A key word used for the audience search

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of export file. Supported values: **csv** and **xls**.

post.description: Use this endpoint to create a list of audiences available for targeting in deals. These include owned audiences and audiences shared by other accounts.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specifies if the sorting must be done in ascending or descending order. Possible values are **ASC** and **DESC**.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The criterion by which you want the list sorted

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Specifies the number of pages to return from the full record set

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specfies the number of records to be listed on a single page

parameters.name: pubToken
parameters.description: A unique token generated by PubMatic that authenticates your access to PubMatic's system

requestBody.description: Criteria by which to retrieve Audience Buyer Insights

get.description:
Use this API to download a template with which you can create audiences in bulk. Some highlights of this template are:
* The row header describes the data for each column.
* It contains information for each of the audiences within the account.
* Each row represents an audience.
* Publishers can download the template, fill in a row for each audience to be created, and upload it using the Audience user interface.
* Once uploaded, the audiences are updated asynchronously.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the account for an audience on PubMatic's platform

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: String specifying the audience category

parameters.name: fileType
parameters.description: String specifying the kind of file to be downloaded

get.description:
Use this API to download a template with which you can create audiences in bulk. Some highlights of this template are:
* The row header describes the data for each column.
* It contains information for each of the audiences within the account.
* Each row represents an audience.
* Publishers can download the template, fill in a row for each audience to be created, and upload it using the Audience user interface.
* Once uploaded, the audiences are updated asynchronously.

parameters.name: audienceCriteria
parameters.description: Attributes defining the audiences you want enumerated

parameters.name: fileType
parameters.description: String specifying the kind of file to be downloaded

get.description: Use this method to retrieve data provider integration information for a specific data provider ID on the PubMatic platform.

parameters.name: dataProviderId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the data provider

put.description: Use this method to modify an existing data provider integration on the PubMatic platform.

parameters.name: dataProviderId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the data provider

post.description: Use this method to create a new data provider on the PubMatic platform.

Use this method to share audiences owned by your account. This makes them available in Private Marketplace (PMP) deals for publishers and Auction Package deals for buyers. Data for shared audiences also appears on audience discovery and insight reports. 

You can share audiences to:
* All
* A list of Publishers
* A list of Buyers
* A ist of Demand Partners
* A linked activate advertiser

You must set share permissions at the source level. After sharing a particular audience with one or more accounts, accounts with which you share anudiences can target those audiences in their deals.

get.description: Use this method to retrieve a list of audiences that have been shared with your account. Other accounts can share audiences with your account individually or in bulk.

parameters.name: sharedAudienceCriteria
parameters.description: Object enumerating attributes of your audience list

get.description: Use this **V2 GET endpoint** to retrieve shared audience relationships. It provides comprehensive filtering, sorting, and pagination capabilities to help you find specific audience sharing information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the shared audience

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: Comma separated unique account identifiers by which to filter

parameters.name: accoundtId
parameters.description: Unique account identifier with which the audience is shared

parameters.name: accountType
parameters.description: String specifying the account type by which to filter

parameters.name: ownerAccountId
parameters.description: Audience owner account unique identifier by which to filter

parameters.name: ownerAccountType
parameters.description: String specifying the audience owner account type by which to filter

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specifies the number of rows the server returns

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Specifies the number of rows the server returns

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Field to sort by. Any valid field name can be used.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specifies the sort order as ascending or descending

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Deletion status by which to filter

parameters.name: excludeBulkSharedRecords
parameters.description: Specifies whether to exclude bulk shared records or not

parameters.name: isOverriddenPrice
parameters.description: Override status by which to filter

parameters.name: dataProviderId
parameters.description: Data provider unique identifier by whch ti filter

404.description: Not Found - No data found for the given criteria

500.description: Internal Server Error - Server error occurred

post.description: First-party data providers (DMPs) who integrate directly with PubMatic can register an audience by providing the `accountType` parameter as `BUYER` along with its PubMatic `accountId`. For data provider accounts, the `accountType` should be `BUYER`.

patch.description: Use this endpoint to modify: `name`, `sdaId` / `cohort`, `description`, `price`, and the enabled (active) flag. You can pass any of these four fields along with all required parameters.

get.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve the details for a specific audience on the PubMatic platform.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: PubMatic account unique identifier

parameters.name: accountType
parameters.description: PubMatic account type

parameters.name: audienceId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the audience

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specifies whether the data is sorted ascending (ASC = default) or descending (DESC)

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The criterion by which you want the list sorted

type.description: Type of the account that owns the audience

AudienceOwnerAccount.description: Details of account that owns the Audience

countryName.description: String specifying the country Unique identifier

providerAudienceId.description: Unique identifier of the provider audience

dataProviderOrganizationName.description: String naming the data provider organization

totalAudience.description: Total unique users count of audience

creationTime.description: Date and time at which the audience was created

price.description: Numeral specifying the price of the audience

audienceType.description: Specifies if the audience is owned or shared

category.description: Specifies the category of the audience

audienceType.description: Specifies if the audience is owned or shared

accountId.description: The unique identifier of your PubMatic account. Find your PubMatic account ID at the upper-right corner of the Media Buyer Console (MBC) UI under ID.

accountType.description: Type of account according to the audience owner

ownerAccountId.description: Unique identifier of the account that owns the audience

ownerAccountType.description: Type of the account that owns the audience

items.description: List of audience IDs to be fetched

segmentStatus.description: Specifies if the audience is enabled or disabled

category.description: Specifies the category of the audience

items.description: Specifies the category of the audience

type.description: Specifies the kind of audience. The value is 0 for simple audiences and 1 for complex audience

priceZero.description: Filter to get audiences with price of $0

totalRecords.description: Numeral specifying the number of records

pageNumber.description: Specifies the number of pages to return from the full record set

numberOfPages.description: Numeral specifying the number of pages to be returned

endRecordNumber.description: Numeral specifying the last record to be returned

startRecordNumber.description: Numeral specifying the first record to be returned

pageSize.description: The maximum number of rows to be included in the response

audienceName.description: The name of the winning audience

dealName.description: The name assigned by the deal's creator during the configuration and creation process

platformName.description: The platform on which the impression was served

winningDealSegmentId.description: The deal's winning audience ID (source segment ID)

date.description: String specifying the date and time of the audience data

dealType.description: String naming the type of deal

targettedDealId.description: Unique identifier of the PubMatic buyer

pubmaticBuyerId.description: Unique identifier of the PubMatic buyer

derivedDspId.description: Unique identifier of the derived DSP

winningDealSegmentId.description: Unique identifier of the winning deal segment

winningDealSegmentMargin.description: String specifying the margin of the winning deal segment

derivedAdFormatId.description: Unique identifier of the derived ad format

paidImpressions.description: Numeral specifying the number of paid impresssions

winningDealSegmentPrice.description: Numeral specifying the price of the winning deal segment

impressionEcpm.description: Numeral specifying the impression effective cost per mille

dataEcpm.description: Numeral specifying the data effective cost per mille

transactionCpm.description: Numeral specifying the transaction cost per mille

transactionFeeType.description: Numeral specifying the transaction fee type

totalDataSpend.description: Total data spend based on the same criteria as totalImpressions.

totalImpressions.description: Total impressions, based on the account ID, type, and deals criteria.

totalSpend.description: Total spend based on the same criteria as totalImpressions.

totalDataSpend.description: Numeral specifying the  total data spending

totalImpressions.description: Numeral specifying the audience total impressions

accountId.description: Unique identifier of a PubMatic account

dataProviderId.description: PubMatic's unique identifier for the provider supplies the data for an account

definition.description: This is the rule data provider's platform for an audience. Doesn't have any meaning on PubMatic's platform other than a textual description of an audience rule.

description.description: An optional description of the purpose, target, and any other relevant information about an audience.

enabled.description: Sets the audience to either active (1) or inactive (0). If 0, the audience is unavailable to use in deals or rules.  Note: deactivating an audience permanently deletes all of the audience data.

name.description: The name of the new audience

price.description: If any entity (Publisher, DSP, or Buyer) wants to sell their audience, this param specifies the sale price. The value must be greater than or equal to 0 else it will default to 0.

providerAudienceId.description: Unique identifier for the provider's audience

queryInfix.description: Required if the audience being created is a custom boolean audience; that is, an audience composed of multiple audiences governed by AND/OR logic.

accountType.description: String specifying the kind of account

accountTypeId.description: Unique identifier of the account type

activationDate.description: Timesstamp specifying when the audience was activated

alwaysOn.description: Numeral specifying that the audience is always on

alwaysOnString.description: String specifying that the audience is always on

audienceGroupId.description: Unique identifier of the audience group

creationTime.description: Timesstamp specifying when the audience was created

dataProviderId.description: Unique identifier of the data provider

dataTypeId.description: Unique identifier of the data type

definition.description: String providing a definition for the audience

description.description: String providing a description for the audience

enabled.description: Numeral specifying that the audience is enabled

enabledForAIMTag.description: Numeral specifying that the audience is enabled for an AIM tag

id.description: Unique identifier of the audience

isAutoDisabled.description: Specifies that the audience is automatically disabled

isAutoRegistered.description: Numeral specifying that the audience is automatically registered

isDeleted.description: Specifies that the audience is deleted

isEnabled.description: String specifying that the audiece is enabled

longName.description: String providing the audience's long name

modificationTime.description: Timesstamp specifying when the audience was modified

parentAudienceId.description: Unique identifier of the parent audience

priceModificationTime.description: Specifies that the audience is always on

private.description: Numeral specifying that the audience is private

providerAudienceId.description: Unique identifier of the provider audience

skipChangeCheck.description: Specifying whether the change check should be skipped or not

skipDealCheck.description: Specifying whether the deal check should be skipped or not

accountId.description: Unique identifier of a PubMatic account

dataProviderId.description: PubMatic's unique identifier for the provider supplies the data for an account.

description.description: An optional description of the purpose, target, and any other relevant information about an audience.

enabled.description: Sets the audience to either active (1) or inactive (0). If 0, the audience is unavailable to use in deals or rules.  Note: deactivating an audience permanently deletes all of the audience data.

id.description: The PubMatic Audience unique identifier

isDeleted.description: Admin and audience owners can use this call to flag an audience as deleted ( 1 ) or not deleted (0 ). If 1, the audience is deleted. Note: audiences are deleted only after they have been inactive > 90 days.

name.description: The name of the new audience

price.description: If any entity (Publisher, DSP, or Buyer) wants to sell their audience, this param specifies the sale price. The value must be greater than or equal to 0 else it will default to 0.

accountId.description: Unique identifier of a PubMatic account

baseAudience.description: 1 = standard audience, 0 = custom boolean audience. Standard audiences have no AND/OR logic rules; for example, "Males, Females". Custom boolean audiences are made of multiple audiences, governed by AND/OR logic; for example, "Males AND New York residents AND age group 20-30"

dataProviderId.description: PubMatic's unique identifier for the provider who supplies the data for an account

dataProviderOrganizationId.description: The unique identifier of the data provider organization

dataProviderOrganizationName.description: Name of the data provider organization

enabled.description: Sets the audience to either active (1) or inactive (0). If 0, the audience is unavailable to use in deals or rules.  Note: deactivating an audience permanently deletes all of the audience data.

id.description: Unique identifier of the audience

providerAudienceId.description: Unique identifier for the provider's audience

searchKey.description: The search string matches on the name or ID of an audience

accountId.description: Unique identifier of a PubMatic account

dataProviderId.description: PubMatic's unique identifier for the provider who supplies the data for an account.

id.description: ID of account on PubMatic platform.Possible values are: 1 (if a first-party data provider being created) and 0 (if a third-party data provider is being created).The id is mandatory if the FPDP value is set to 1. In these cases, the account id must be a valid ID on PubMatic platform.

type.description: Type of account on PubMatic platform

name.description: Name of the account on the PubMatic platform

DataProviderAccountSwagger.description: Accounts linked to this data provider. Response would have non zero account ID for third-party data provider, if request query parameters account ID and account type are passed. If these two parameters are not passed, third-party data provider would have publisher ID 0.

description.description: More information about the data provider organization

id.description: Unique identifier of the data provider organization

name.description: Name of the data provider organization

DataProviderOrganizationSwagger.description: Information about the data management partner (DMP) of the integration

dataProviderId.description: Publisher account linked to this data provider. Publisher ID would be 0 for third party data provider.Response would have non zero publisher ID for third party data provider, if request query parameters account ID and account type are passed.If these two parameters are no passed, third part data provider would have publisher ID 0.

frequency.description: Frequency determines how many times in a day the pixel would be fired. For example, if frequency is set to 1, the pixel would fire once per day per user.

id.description: Unique identifier of the data provider pixel

url.description: This is the pixel Uniform Resource Locator.

DataProviderPixelSwagger.description: List of data provider pixels. Pixels can be UID sync-up pixel and data transfer pixel.

id.description: Unique identifier of the pixel type

name.description: Pixel type name (e.g., IMAGE, JAVA SCRIPT, IFrame)

DataProviderPixelTypeSwagger.description: Type of the pixel like UID Sync-up pixel and data transfer pixel. Please see below table for object structure.

accounts.description: Accounts linked to this data provider. Response would have non zero account ID for third-party data provider, if request query parameters account ID and account type are passed. If these two parameters are not passed, third-party data provider would have publisher ID 0.

category.description: Category of the audience. All audiences that are allowed to be created will match the category of the dataProviderId. Seller Defined Audiences are limited to only one per dataProviderId.

creationTime.description: Date and time at which the data provider was created

dataProviderPixels.description: List of data provider pixels. Pixels can be UID sync-up pixel and data transfer pixel.

enabled.description: This flag indicates whether the data provider is enabled or not.

fpdp.description: This flag that indicates if data provider is first-party or third-party. First-party data providers are registered separately for every publisher integration (e.g. Krux). Third-party data providers are registered once and this applies across all publisher integration (e.g. Lotame).

id.description: Unique identifier of the data provider

modificationTime.description: Timestamp to track the last modification time of the data provider

privacyPolicyUrl.description: If the data provider is included in a universal pixel being created, then the privacyPolicyUrl of the data provider must be accepted in order to proceed with the universal pixel creation.

pushEnabled.description:
This flag stores the ingestion status for the data provider.
 1 = All HTTP requests for this DPID will be accepted.
 0 = HTTP requests sent by third-party data providers will not be ingested.

segmentCount.description: The number of segments created under the data provider integration

visible.description:
This flag decides if a data provider should be visible on the publisher UI for operations like creating universal pixel, etc.
Sometime while integrating with a data provider, the registration is complete but the S2S integration/UID sync-up setup part is pending. Such data providers shouldn't be used to create universal pixels unless all integration steps are done.

monitoringEnabled.description: This setting is related to data ingestion. If monitoring is enabled, the ad server will log information about the requests sent to PubMatic. These logs can further be used for debug purpose. Monitoring is usually enabled during the integration phase of a data provider.

sharePermission.description: Possible values are NONE, ALL_BUYERS_DSPS, ALL_PUBLISHERS and ALL. Flag to indicate the permission on sharing of audience with other accounts. The account will only be able to share their audiences with other Publishers / DSPs / Buyers if they have permission to share audiences with that entity. Ex If share permission is set to PUBLISHER, the account will not be able to share their audience with buyer/DSP.

uidType.description: Possible values are COOKIE and DEVICE. Flag to indicate if the integration is for device (Android / IOS) targeting or for browser targeting. If uidType is DEVICE, the DMP is required to send deviceIds. If uidType is COOKIE, the DMP is required to send the cookie ids.

DataProviderSettingsSwagger.description: General settings that are configured at the integration level.

id.description: Unique identifier of the Uniform Resource Locator type

name.description: Uniform Resource Locator type name (e.g., SYNC_UP_URL, DATA_TRANSFER_URL)

DataProviderURLTypeSwagger.description: Type of the URL like image, javascript, and iframe. Please see below table for object structure.

accountTypeId.description: Unique identifier of the account type

id.description: Unique identifier of the account
Unique identifier of the data provider

enabled.description: Numeral specifying that the data provider is enabled

pushEnabled.description: Numeral specifying that the data provider push enabled

privacyPolicyUrl.description: String specifying the privacy policy Uniform Resource Locator

modificationTime.description: Timesstamp specifying when the data provider was modified

creationTime.description: Timesstamp specifying when the data provider was created

visible.description: Numeral specifying that the data provider is visible

category.description: String specifying the data provider category

id.description: Unique identifier of the data provider organization

name.description: String naming the data provider organization

privacyPolicyUrl.description: String specifying the privacy policy Uniform Resource Locator

dataProviderId.description: Unique identifier of the data provider

id.description: Unique identifier of the dtat provider pixel
Unique identifier of the pixel type
Unique identifier of the URL type

accounts.description: This refers to the account linked to this data provider. It's an array; however, for the data provider create/update request, only the first record is considered.

category.description: Category of the audience. All audiences that are allowed to be created will match the category of the dataProviderId. Seller Defined Audiences are limited to only one per dataProviderId.

dataProviderPixels.description: List of data provider pixels. Pixels can be UID sync-up pixel and data transfer pixel.

enabled.description: This flag indicates whether the data provider is enabled or not.

fpdp.description: This flag that indicates if data provider is first-party or third-party. First-party data providers are registered separately for every publisher integration (e.g. Krux). Third-party data providers are registered once and this applies across all publisher integration (e.g. Lotame).

organizationId.description: The id of the organization under which the data provider is being created.

pushEnabled.description: This flag stores the ingestion status for the data provider. 1 = all HTTP requests for this DPID will be accepted, 0 = HTTP requests sent by third-party data providers will not be ingested

id.description: Id of the account with which to share the audience. Pass 0 to share the audience with all accounts of the account type

AccountSwagger.description: A list of objects containing information about the account with which the audience will be shared (accountID, accountType, and dataProviderID).

accounts.description: This refers to the account linked to this data provider. It's an array; however, for the data provider create/update request, only the first record is considered.

category.description: Category of the audience. All audiences that are allowed to be created will match the category of the dataProviderId. Seller Defined Audiences are limited to only one per dataProviderId.

dataProviderPixels.description: List of data provider pixels. Pixels can be UID sync-up pixel and data transfer pixel.

enabled.description: This flag indicates whether the data provider is enabled or not.

fpdp.description: This flag that indicates if data provider is first-party or third-party. First-party data providers are registered separately for every publisher integration (e.g. Krux). Third-party data providers are registered once and this applies across all publisher integration (e.g. Lotame).

organizationId.description: The id of the organization under which the data provider is being created.

privacyPolicyUrl.description: If the data provider is included in a universal pixel being created, then the privacyPolicyUrl of the data provider must be Accepted in order to proceed with the universal pixel creation.

pushEnabled.description: This flag stores the ingestion status for the data provider. 1 = all HTTP requests for this DPID will be accepted, 0 = HTTP requests sent by third-party data providers will not be ingested

accountId.description: The ID of your PubMatic account. Find your PubMatic account ID at the upper-right corner of the Media Buyer Console (MBC) UI under ID.

dataProviderId.description: PubMatic's unique identifier for the provider who supplies the data for an audience. You can find the DPID on the PubMatic platform under Audience > Audience Settings.

id.description: Unique identifier of the shared audience

ShareAudience.description: This object contains information about the audiences ID (PubMatic ID), as well as the audience owner (accountId, accountType, and dataProviderId).

deleted.description: Pass TRUE to delete the sharing entry. Pass FALSE (default) to continue sharing the audience.

deletedId.description: Unique identifier of the deleted item

id.description: Unique identifier of the shared audience

accountTypeId.description: Unique identifier of the account type

activationDate.description: Timesstamp specifying when the audience was activated

alwaysOn.description: Numeral specifying that the audience is always on

creationTime.description: Timesstamp specifying when the audience was created

dataProviderId.description: Unique identifier of the data provider

dealCount.description: Numeral specifying the number of deals

enabled.description: Numeral indicating that the audience is enabled

id.description: Unique identifier

isAutoDisabled.description: String specifying that the audience is automatically disabled

isAutoRegistered.description: Numeral specifying that the audience is automatically registered

isDeleted.description: Numeral specifying that the audience is deleted

isEnabled.description: String specifying that the audience is enabled

longName.description: String providing the audience's long name

modificationTime.description: Timesstamp specifying when the audience was modified

priceModificationTime.description: Specifies the data and time at which the price was modified

providerAudienceId.description: Unique identifier of the provider audience

type.description: Numeral specifying the kind of audience

category.description: String specifying the category of the audience

description.description: An optional description of the purpose, target, and any other relevant information about an audience

enabled.description: Sets the audience to either active (**1**) or inactive (**0**). If **0**, the audience is unavailable to use in deals or rules.  Note: deactivating an audience permanently deletes all of the audience data.

name.description: The name of the new audience

dataProviderId.description: PubMatic's unique identifier for the provider who supplies the data for an account

id.description: The PubMatic audience unique identifier

name.description: The name of the new audience

description.description: An optional description of the purpose, target, and any other relevant information about an audience

enabled.description: Sets the audience to either active (**1**) or inactive (**0**). If **0**, the audience is unavailable to use in deals or rules.  Note: deactivating an audience permanently deletes all of the audience data.

audienceId.description: Unique identifier of the account for an audience on PubMatic's platform (not Source Audience ID).

ownerAccountId.description: Your account ID on PubMatic's platform. (You can find your account ID at the top-right of the Media Buyer Console (MBC) UI under ID.)

pageSize.description: The maximum number of rows to be included in the response

pageNumber.description: Page number to fetch in the case of multiple pages.

accountId.description: Unique identifier of a valid PubMatic account. Value must be greater than zero.

customAudienceJsonExpression.description: Array of audience groups that define the combined audience logic. Each group represents a set of audiences with **And**/**Or** relationships. It must contain two but no more than six groups.

description.description: An optional description of the purpose, target, and any other relevant information about the combined audience.
description.example: Combined audience targeting premium automobile enthusiasts with high purchase intent

enabled.description: Sets the audience to either active (1) or inactive (0). If 0, the audience is unavailable to use in deals or rules.

name.description: The name of the new combined audience. Must be unique within the account.

price.description: The sale price for the combined audience. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

priceType.description: The pricing model for the combined audience

type.description: Nummeral specifying the kind of audience. This must be set to 1 for combined audiences.

audIds.description: Array of audiences that belong to this group. These must be existing, valid audiences.

category.description: Numeral specifying the category for the group

groupId.description: Unique identifier for the group within the combined audience expression

isNot.description: Specifies whether to apply *Not* logic to this group

accountId.description: Unique identifier of a PubMatic account. Must match the account that owns the audience.

accountType.description: String specifying the PubMatic account type. Must match the account type.

customAudienceJsonExpression.description: Updated array of audience groups. If provided, must contain a miniumun of two and a maximum of six groups.

dataProviderId.description: Data provider unique identifier associated with the combined audience. Required for validation.

description.description: Updated description of the combined audience.
description.example: Updated description for premium automobile enthusiasts with enhanced targeting

enabled.description: Numeral that specifies the audience as either active (1) or inactive (0)

name.description: Updated name of the combined audience. Must be unique within the account if provided.

price.description: Updated sale price for the combined audience. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

priceType.description: Updated pricing model for the combined audience

type.description: Numeral specifying the kind of audience. This must be set to 1 for combined audiences.

accountId.description: Unique identifier for the account that owns this combined audience

accountName.description: Name of the account that owns this combined audience

accountType.description: String specifying the type of the account

alwaysOn.description: Specifies whether the audience is always on or not

category.description: String specifyng the category of the combined audience

creationTime.description: Date on which the combined audience was created

customAudienceJsonExpression.description: JSON expression defining the combined audience groups

dataProviderId.description: Auto-generated or assigned data provider unique identifier

description.example: Combined audience targeting premium automobile enthusiasts with high purchase intent

enabled.description: Numeral specifying whether the combined audience is enabled (1) or disabled (0)

favourite.description: String specifying whether the audience is marked as favourite or not

id.description: Unique identifier of the created combined audience

isAutoDisabled.description: Specifies whether the audience is auto-disabled or not

isAutoRegistered.description: Specifies whether the audience is auto-registered or not

isDeleted.description: Specifies whether the audience is deleted or not

longName.description: Long name of the combined audience

modificationTime.description: Date on which the combined audience was last modified

price.description: Numeral specifying the price of the combined audience

priceModificationTime.description: Date on which the price was last modified

priceType.description: Pricing model of the combined audience

private.description: Specifies whether the audience is private or not

skipChangeCheck.description: Specifies whether to skip the change check or not

skipDealCheck.description: Specifies whether to skip the deal check or not

transferCode.description: Transfer code for the combined audience

type.description: Type of audience (1 for combined audiences)
